document.docAuthor: Pisanty, Gideon, Scheuchl, Erwin & Dorchin, Netta
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic review of the subgenus Andrena (Poecilandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in Israel and the Levant

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic review of the subgenus Andrena (Poecilandrena) (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae) in Israel and the Levant

heading.emphasis:
Key to the
Andrena ( Poecilandrena )
species of the Levant (males):

keyStep.paragraph:
..............................................................................
A. crassana inka Warncke
- Tergum 4 finely punctured, distance between punctures 1–1.5 puncture diameters (Fig. 72). Flagellomere 1 as long as 3 ( Fig. 74 ). Mesonotum polished and very shiny medially ( Fig. 90 ). Mesepisternum shallowly rugose-areolate ( Fig. 28 ). Gonocoxite without dorsal lobe ( Fig. 116 )...........................................
A. sedumella Scheuchl & Pisanty
n. sp.

paragraph.keyLead:
7 Genital capsule relatively rounded, penis valves with broad lateral lamellar extensions, gonostylus blade strongly tapering apically ( Fig. 118 ). Mesonotum and metasoma smooth, relatively coarsely and densely punctured, distance between punctures on tergum 2 1–1.5 puncture diameters ( Figs. 92 , 105 ). Clypeus yellow ( Fig. 79 ).......
A. freidbergi Pisanty & Scheuchl
n. sp.

- Genital capsule narrower, penis valves with narrow lateral lamellar extensions, gonostylus blade weakly tapering apically ( Fig. 119 ). Mesonotum and metasoma weakly to strongly shagreened, relatively finely and sparsely punctured, distance between punctures on tergum 2 2–3 puncture diameters ( Figs. 93 , 106 ). Clypeus dark or yellow ( Fig. 80 )........
A. kilikiae Warncke

10 Gonocoxite with well-developed, elongate dorsal lobe ( Fig. 123 ). Head and mesosoma bluish-metallic ( Fig. 110 )...........................................................................................
A. semirubra Morawitz
